parameters: \pop[2]I feel like this place is basically my second home.

\pop[2]But just like Dante, this time it was for a one-on-one meeting.
\pop[2]And not just with anybody, but the newest addition to our group.
\pop[2]He specifically requested it, too. Somehow, I found that kind of flattering.
\pop[2]When I think about it, he approached me at the nightclub, too.
\pop[2]Maybe it's just like he said. Lost and clueless, but together.
\pop[2]With everything going on, that seems to fit my mindset more and more.
\pop[2]So much is up in the air, I just wish a few things would start to land.
\pop[2]Even if they didn't stick that landing, at least I could stop worrying.

You know, this time, I'm not actually hungover.
Might be a good time to try something different.

\pop[3]Been having a lot of those gummies, too.

It's both good and bad, though. Gotta watch that waistline.
\pop[2]He takes a big sip of the ice water in front of him.
\pop[3]Just one of the many things I'm contractually obligated to do.
You know, the work never stops, even when you think it does.
Hiatus? It's basically nothing more than a glorified formality.
\pop[2]So the industry controls his body, in addition to his personal life?
\pop[2]Everything about what he's been telling me just seems awful.
\pop[2]He shakes his head, like he's stopping an incoming rant.
\pop[3]Sorry. I invited you here because I wanted to apologize.
I still feel really bad for that conversation we had at the nightclub.
After a few drinks, I guess I just start to say whatever comes to mind.
\i[5]"Actually, it was kind of the highlight of my night."
\i[2]"Don't feel bad. I'd love to do it again sometime."
\i[6]"You spilled all kinds of fun secrets. Can't wait to tell everyone."

I kinda figured that would stand out a bit more than me.
Thanks though, Delta. I was worried I scared you away.

\pop[2]It must be his diary, a place to vent all his woes.
\pop[3]That's why I usually keep that stuff in here...

But it's hard work, and sometimes it's nice to speak my feelings.

\pop[3]It felt a lot better to talk to another person, too...
Until now, I always just wrote that stuff in here.
\pop[3]That's just some advice from my old manager, though.
Never vent to another person, they're walking gossip machines.
He didn't even want me to keep notes in my phone. Just this diary.
\pop[2]But I guess it's for the best, given how "in the spotlight" he is.
\pop[2]I choose not to speak, letting him continue talking about himself.
\pop[3]But he's not my manager anymore, I guess.
Passed away a while back, during my world tour.
They just... gave me a new one, like he didn't even matter.
\pop[3]But I guess I don't really matter, either.
When I'm gone, another idol will step right up.
It's like a machine. It just... keeps going, despite you.
\pop[2]He looks off to the side, like he's sad and ashamed.
\pop[2]Right after apologizing, he's already back to talking about work.
\pop[2]I can kind of understand. He's known little else for his entire life.
\pop[2]He flips through the pages of his diary, directing my attention toward it.
\pop[2]I didn't mean to snoop, the motion just drew the attention of my eyes.
\pop[2]I can see a sketch. A happy family standing next to a car.
\pop[2]They all had names drawn beside them, but the page moved far too fast.
\pop[2]All I could make out was that one of their names started with a "W".
\pop[2]I quickly look back up at Klace as he continues to talk.
I wasn't old enough to sign my initial contracts, so he did it for me.
Honestly, he was the closest thing I ever had to something normal.
\pop[3]They kept bugging me, saying I had to sign new contracts of my own.
I managed to negotiate this hiatus, so I could have some time off.
Told them it was so I could grieve, but I just wanted time away.
\pop[3]A breath of fresh air can change almost anything.
Especially when you're locked inside all the time, like I was.
This life is brand new for me. Just like it is for you, Delta.
\pop[2]He places his hand on top of mine.
\pop[3]And that's why I feel like we have something special.
Even if it's just a lingering feeling, that'll slowly fade away.
You may get to keep this life; but for me, it's just a glimpse.
\pop[2]Something inside of me feels really weird.
\pop[2]I can't tell if he's trying to be romantic, or just a good friend.
\pop[2]But when he speaks now, I don't feel that anxiety - that hesitation.
\pop[2]Just like when he blew that kiss to the crowd, and put on a smile.
\pop[2]There's something about this that feels like it could be an act, too.
\pop[2]Perhaps he's just trying to exit his comfort zone, while he still can.
\pop[3]You know, you learn a thing or two in this industry.
